inference.passage: Herbicide use in some areas of the U.S. was prevented this year because of heavy rains.
inference.question: Were herbicides used this year in the U.S.?

answer.because: Conversational implicature. Namely, if it is reported that p does not happen in some areas, that let us assume that p happens in other areas.

inference.passage: Sardar Patel faced imprisonment for the first time when he was assisting Gandhiji in the Salt Satyagraha.
inference.question: Was Sardar Patel ever in prison?

answer.assumptions: One reading. We don't know whether he ended up in prison and the question refers to that possible imprisonment (see next interpretation).
One reading. The question has an implicit 'before' and therefore is asking about previous possible imprisonments that hadn't taken place.

inference.passage: Sardar Patel faced imprisonment for the first time when he was assisting Gandhiji in the Salt Satyagraha.
inference.question: Was Sardar Patel ever convicted of a crime?

answer.because: Usually when you are imprisoned you are convicted of something.
